00248 #ifdef WATCOM
00249 #define POS_SCHED_LOCK           _asm {"pushf\ncli"}
00250 #else
00251 #ifdef GCC
00252 #define POS_SCHED_LOCK           asm volatile("pushf\n" "cli\n"::)
00253 #else
00254 #define POS_SCHED_LOCK           asm { PUSHF; CLI }
00255 #endif
00256 #endif
00257 
00262 #ifdef WATCOM
00263 #define POS_SCHED_UNLOCK         _asm {"popf"}
00264 #else
00265 #ifdef GCC
00266 #define POS_SCHED_UNLOCK         asm volatile("popf\n"::)
00267 #else
00268 #define POS_SCHED_UNLOCK         asm POPF
00269 #endif
00270 #endif

00371 #if DOX!=0
00372 
00377 #define POS_USERTASKDATA  void *stackptr;
00378 #else
00379 
00380 /* Here is an example for different memory handling types:
00381  */
00382 
00383 #if POSCFG_TASKSTACKTYPE == 0
00384 
00385 #define POS_USERTASKDATA \
00386    void  *stackptr;
00387 
00388 #elif POSCFG_TASKSTACKTYPE == 1
00389 
00390 #define POS_USERTASKDATA \
00391    void  *stackptr; \
00392    void  *stackroot;
00393 
00394 #elif POSCFG_TASKSTACKTYPE == 2
00395 
00396 #define FIXED_STACK_SIZE 0x0600
00397 #define POS_USERTASKDATA \
00398    void  *stackptr; \
00399    unsigned short stack[FIXED_STACK_SIZE];
00400 
00401 #endif
00402 
00403 #endif /* DOX */
